lenders.name: Michael

lenders.name: Trevor
lenders.loan_because: we are a co-operative and this is how we show we care.
lenders.occupational_info: ACYL is a non-profit organization focusing on co-operative educationand empowerment for youth across Atlantic Canada.  As a co-operative organization it is with great humility that we do whatever we can to assist people who need it the most.  Co-op principle # 7

lenders.name: Amy
lenders.occupational_info: I work with children in a low-income neighborhood on the southwest side of Charlotte.  I raise money for the programs, recruit volunteers for tutoring and mentoring, and work with our church partners to communicate needs.

lenders.name: Susan
lenders.loan_because: I no longer loan via kiva because I am appalled at Kiva's stance with regard to cruelty against animals. I do not wish to support cockfighting, however indirectly, and Kiva's refusal to block cockfighting loans (despite repeatedly being made aware of the concerns of many Kivans) is a great disappointment to me. Maybe cockfighting is part of the "tradition" in other countries but so is female genital mutilation. Should we support this, too? Not everything that's done in other cultures is "something of value".

lenders.name: Lisa
lenders.loan_because: all people across the globe deserve to live their lives with dignity and have the opportunity to improve their lives.
lenders.occupational_info: Director of Global Education Programs (for high school students) that promote international understanding and the development of awareness of global food security issues.

One can earn $1000-1500 easily.

When I browsed the KIVA webpage I realised that a small amount (in our eyes) will make a big difference in someone else's. It is a privilege to be part of this organisation and assist where we can!
